intro: Cladandra, commonly known as the goldenbush, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Asteraceae. These shrubs are native to southern Africa and are characterized by their dense, compact growth habit and showy yellow flowers. The leaves are typically narrow and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are often woody and branched. Cladandra species are adapted to arid environments, showcasing drought tolerance through their succulent-like leaves and deep root systems. They play an important role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
